TEXT.English: The most basic of government civics, to be abandoned at the earliest convenience.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National Art Gallery[COLOR_REVERT] doubles its city's cultural output and increases its chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Eremitage[COLOR_REVERT] verdoppelt den kulturellen Ausstoß einer Stadt. Außerdem erhöht es die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Künstler[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: A government civic that focuses on maintaining a large empire and military. In RI, this encompasses all forms of absolute monarchy, as opposed to Monarchy civic that represents monarchies where the monarch's power is checked.

A government civic that focuses on maintaining a large empire and economic growth. In RI, this encompasses all forms of limited monarchy, as opposed to Autocracy civic that represents monarchies where the monarch's power is unchecked. Examples include feudal, elective or constitutional monarchies.

A government civic focused on running an overextended empire, sacrificing some military and economic aspects. In RI, this encompasses all instances where a civilization is historically represented by many independent entities - collections of city states, confederacies and leagues.

A government civic focused on effectively running smaller empires, both economically and militarily. In RI, this encompasses all forms of early governments not ruled as monarchies - be it Greek-style direct democracies, Venice-style merchant republics, or early federations.
Provides happiness to your larger cities and later on allows between a federal or a centralist constitution.
Well-suited for modern warfare. The power is in the hands of the military.
Lower upkeep costs make this civic well-suited for larger empires; note a significant bonus to GP generation.
Unlike most initial civics, this one can be useful throughout the entire span of the game.
No outstanding bonuses, but able to complement other civics well due to its multi-faceted nature.
The non-military production of your cities is improved.
You might have known this one as "Vassalage" in vanilla Civ 4.
Trade and industry are the keys of their power.
The State and its Army are everywhere. The Big Brother is watching you!
Emphasises culture with +100% culture output and unlimited artists.
Additional commerce from mines and plantations and a new commercial building, at a cost of revolt risk.
Additional commerce and food from farms and a new production building, at a cost of revolt risk.
More production and happiness in the cities that share your religion, at a cost of slower GP birth rate.
Faster improvement construction and town growth.
Halfway from Serfdom to Labor Union, this civic no longer has serf rebellions, and settlements grow faster.
These modern slaves boost your production and improvement construction rate.
Provides happiness to those who have it and unhappiness to those who don't.
Raising of livestock will boost the yields of your pastures, but lower the yield of your farms.
Earn extra gold from certain improvements. Allows construction of the Guild Halls.
Gives each city one more trade route and allows you to construct Great Arsenal wonder.
Protect your economy with Import Tariffs and restrictive Quotas.
Extra trade routes in each city; better trade income.
Carry out a total control over the economy.
Provides lots of health, happiness but avoid wars!
Extra health and production from jungle tiles, at the cost of not being able to run a religion or construct pagan temples.
With a State Religion, boost your production and espionage capacities.
Allow missionaries without monasteries and boosts your culture.
In the name of God, quickly build a strong army and burn the infidels.
Love the charismatic leader! He works for you!
Selected workers and standardized methods increase your production.
TEXT.German: Selected workers and standardized methods increase your production.

TEXT.English: Basic educational and healthcare rights for everyone.
TEXT.German: Basic educational and healthcare rights for everyone.

TEXT.English: Increase your food production and work speed.
TEXT.German: Increase your food production and work speed.

TEXT.English: The first one to research this tech founds [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianism[COLOR_REVERT]. It also leads to [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Priesthood[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der Erste, der diese Technologie erkundet, gründet die Religion [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianismus[COLOR_REVERT]. Sie führt auch zum [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Priestertum[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: It enables the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Caste System[COLOR_REVERT] civic and allows construction of [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouses[COLOR_REVERT] and the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chichen Itza[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
TEXT.German: Dieser ermöglicht die Staatsform [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kastensystem[COLOR_REVERT] und ermöglicht Ihnen den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gerichtsgebäuden[COLOR_REVERT] und des Wunders von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chichen Itza[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomy[COLOR_REVERT] allows the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleon[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Frigate[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chemistry[COLOR_REVERT]) naval units. It enables trading on the ocean and lets you build [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatories[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Astronomie[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht den Bau der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galeone[COLOR_REVERT] und der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fregatte[COLOR_REVERT] (wenn Sie die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Chemie[COLOR_REVERT] bereits erforscht haben). Sie zentriert die Weltkarte und ermöglicht den Seehandel und den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatorien[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Railroad[COLOR_REVERT] allows construction of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Machine Gun[COLOR_REVERT] units and obsoletes the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colossus[COLOR_REVERT] wonder. Most importantly, with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coal[COLOR_REVERT] it allows your workers to upgrade your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Railroads[COLOR_REVERT], vastly increasing your units' movement.
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Eisenbahn[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maschinengewehren[COLOR_REVERT] und macht das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Koloss[COLOR_REVERT]-Wunder überflüssig. Haben Sie die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kohle[COLOR_REVERT] bereits entdeckt, können Ihre Bautrupps Ihre [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Straßen[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Schienenwege[COLOR_REVERT] verbessern, um den Bewegungswert Ihrer Einheiten deutlich zu erhöhen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Harbor[COLOR_REVERT] provides an additional trade route to the city.
TEXT.German: Ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hafen[COLOR_REVERT] erhöht das Handelseinkommen einer Stadt und erschließt die resourcen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fisch[COLOR_REVERT]. Diese wirken sich wiederum positiv auf die Gesundheit Ihrer Bevölkerung aus.

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grocer[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's commerce, health and food. It also further increases the city's health with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Spices[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Citrus[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hemp[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bananas[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Krämer[COLOR_REVERT] steigert den Wohlstand einer Stadt. Darüber hinaus erhöht der Zugriff auf verschiedene resourcen die Zufriedenheit der Bevölkerung. Für den Bau einer [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bank[COLOR_REVERT] ist ebenfalls ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Krämer[COLOR_REVERT] erforderlich.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temples[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's happiness and culture. They are especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tempel[COLOR_REVERT] steigern die Zufriedenheit und Kultur einer Stadt. Sie eignen sich hervorragend, um Ihre Zivilisation bereits in der Frühphase des Spiels zu vergrößern.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monasteries[COLOR_REVERT] allow you to create [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Magi[COLOR_REVERT], who can spread the faith in other cities. They also provide culture and a slight boost to research.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Klöster[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglichen die Ausbildung von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missionaren[COLOR_REVERT]. Diese verkünden in anderen Städten Ihren Glauben, steigern den kulturellen Wert und beschleunigen die Forschung.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zoroastrian Fire Temple[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zoroastrian Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT]) greatly increases a city's cultural output. It makes a city's citizens happy (if [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianism[COLOR_REVERT] is the state religion).
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zoroastrische Feuertempell[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zoroastrische Kathedrale[COLOR_REVERT]) erhöht den kulturellen Ausstoß einer Stadt deutlich. Ist der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrismus[COLOR_REVERT] in einer Stadt Staatsreligion, steigt die Zufriedenheit der Bevölkerung.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Adur Burzen-Mihr[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zoroastrian Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces one gold each turn for every city in the world that practises [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianism[COLOR_REVERT]. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrianism[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Adur Burzen-Mihr[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zorostrianischer Schrein[COLOR_REVERT]) produziert in allen Städten, die den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrismus[COLOR_REVERT] praktizieren, 1 Gold/Runde. Außerdem verbreitet er den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Zoroastrismus[COLOR_REVERT] in aller Welt und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broadway[COLOR_REVERT] provides your civilization with five [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Musicals[COLOR_REVERT] resources (which provide happiness). It increases the odds that its city will generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Durch den Bau des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Broadways[COLOR_REVERT] erhält Ihre Zivilisation fünf [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Musicals[COLOR_REVERT] zur Steigerung der Zufriedenheit Ihrer Bevölkerung. Darüber hinaus erhöhen sich die Chancen der Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Künstler[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rock-n-Roll[COLOR_REVERT] provides your civilization with five [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Singles[COLOR_REVERT] resources (which provide happiness). It increases the odds that its city will create a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Durch die Entwicklung des [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rock 'n Roll[COLOR_REVERT] erhält Ihre Zivilisation fünf [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hitsingles[COLOR_REVERT] zur Steigerung der Zufriedenheit Ihrer Bevölkerung. Darüber hinaus erhöhen sich die Chancen der Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Künstler[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hollywood[COLOR_REVERT] provides your civilization with five [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Movies[COLOR_REVERT] resources (which provide happiness). It increases the odds that its city will generate a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hollywood[COLOR_REVERT] versorgt Ihre Zivilisation mit fünf [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Filmhits[COLOR_REVERT] zur Steigerung der Zufriedenheit Ihrer Bevölkerung. Darüber hinaus erhöhen sich die Chancen der Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Künstler[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: Plutonium Nuclear Silo is built automatically in each city after building a Fusion Plant. Plutonium Nuclear Silo can build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ICBM_P[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Plutoniumraketensilos werden automatisch in jeder Stadt errichtet, wenn ein Fusionskraftwerk errichtet wurde. Plutoniumraketensilos können [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]ICBM_P[COLOR_REVERT] bauen.

TEXT.English: Provides a free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nuclear Silo[COLOR_REVERT] in all of your cities and enables all eligible players to build nukes.
Provides a free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nuclear Silo[COLOR_REVERT] in all of your cities.
Provides a free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nuclear Silo[COLOR_REVERT] in all of your cities.
Provides a free [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Nuclear Silo[COLOR_REVERT] in all of your cities.
The Mausoleum makes your Golden Ages last longer.
Until the birth of the Great Religions, Pagan Temples provide varied small bonuses. Linked to some civics and wonders, more bonuses are available.
Build this wonder to get a unique Tuna Fish bonus resource to increase health in your empire!
TEXT.German: Erbauen Sie dieses Wunder um einen einzigartigen Thunfischbonus zu erlangen, und die Gesundheit in Ihrem Imperium zu verbessern.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Writing[COLOR_REVERT] allows you to sign [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT] trading agreements with other civilizations, which also boost your scientific research if your neighbor posses knowledge you don't have... But be careful, it also works the other way around!
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Schrift[COLOR_REVERT] erlaubt Ihnen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Offene Grenzen[COLOR_REVERT] Handelsabkommen mit anderen Zivilisationen, die auch Ihre wissenschaftliche Forschung beschleunigen, wenn Ihr Nachbar über Wissen verfügt, welches Sie noch nicht haben... Vorsicht: Dies geht auch in die andere Richtung!

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alphabet[COLOR_REVERT] enables you to construct [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Libraries[COLOR_REVERT], which boost research.
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alphabet[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht den Bau von [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bibliotheken[COLOR_REVERT], die Ihre Forschung anhebt, und Ihren Städten erlaubt [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Forschung[COLOR_REVERT] zu bauen.

TEXT.English: This tech allows you to build powerful [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] units (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Horseback Riding[COLOR_REVERT]). [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Civil Service[COLOR_REVERT] enables also the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bureaucracy[COLOR_REVERT] civic and allows you to build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Macemen[COLOR_REVERT] (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Machinery[COLOR_REVERT]). Further, it lets your workers spread [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Irrigation[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Diese Technologie erlaubt die Erschaffung von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rittern[COLOR_REVERT] (mit [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Reiten[COLOR_REVERT]). [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Civil Service[COLOR_REVERT] erlaubt auch die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bürokratie[COLOR_REVERT] und gestattet die Errichtung von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Streikolbenkämpfer[COLOR_REVERT] (mit [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Machinenbau[COLOR_REVERT]).

TEXT.English: This tech allows you to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grocer[COLOR_REVERT] city improvement. It increases production from all workshops by 1.
TEXT.German: Diese Technologie ermöglicht den Bau einer Modernisierung ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Krämer[COLOR_REVERT]). Darüber hinaus steigt die Produktion aller Werkstätten um 1.

TEXT.English: This is the first print press machinery, use it to produce books for your own use and also for export!
TEXT.German: Dies ist die erste Druckmachine, benutzen Sie sie um Bücher für sie und den Export zu produzieren!

TEXT.English: Build this wonder to get a boost in science, global health and reduce epidemic chance.
TEXT.German: Bauen Sie dieses Wunder um einen Forschungsschub , Gesundheit und Wissenschaftler zu erlangen.

TEXT.English: Build this wonder to get a boost in science, global health and reduce epidemic chance.
TEXT.German: Bauen Sie dieses Wunder um einen Forschungsschub , Gesundheit und Wissenschaftler zu erlangen.

TEXT.English: Provides +2 additional experience to all new units.
TEXT.German: Möchten Sie einen Krieg führen, sollten Sie die Kunst der Kriegsführung verstehen. Militärische Erfahrung ist der Schlüssel.

TEXT.English: Build this to get a great boost in culture.
TEXT.German: Erbauen Sie dieses Wunder um einen Kulturanstieg zu erlangen.

TEXT.English: Build this to get a great boost in culture.
TEXT.German: Erbauen Sie dieses Wunder um einen Kulturanstieg zu erlangen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caravan House[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from trade routes and raises commerce output from various improvements.
TEXT.German: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caravan House[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from trade roads as well as raising gold input from various improvements.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caravansarai[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from trade routes and raises commerce output from various improvements; in addition, Transoxiana gains +1 free specialist per Silk Road Trading Town in the radius of the city with a Caravanserai.
TEXT.German: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caravan House[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from trade roads as well as raising gold input from various improvements.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caravanserai[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from trade routes and raises commerce output from various improvements.
TEXT.German: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caravanserai[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from trade routes and raises commerce output from various improvements.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Native Factory[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from trade routes and raises commerce output from various improvements. It also provides one more commerce yield per river title.
TEXT.German: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Native Factory[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from trade roads as well as raising gold input from various improvements. It also provides one more gold yield per river title.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Trading post[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from foreign trade routes and provides happiness from sugar, coffee and tobacco.
TEXT.German: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Trading post[COLOR_REVERT] increases income from foreign trade roads and provides happiness from sugar, coffee and tobacco.

TEXT.English: This building provides defense to units within its city, and sets the framework for a stone wall later on.
TEXT.German: Die Palisaden schützen Ihre Einheiten etwas gegen feindliche Angriffe, und bilden die Basis für spätere Stadtmauern.

TEXT.English: This building provides a health bonus and epidemic chance reduction.
TEXT.German: Brunnen liefern Trinkwasser und verbessern damit die Gesundheit Ihrer Bürger.

TEXT.English: This expensive building provides a large health bonus.
TEXT.German: Brunnen liefern Trinkwasser und verbessern damit die Gesundheit Ihrer Bürger.

TEXT.English: This building depends on Cult of Personality, lowers war exhaustion and raises military unit production.
TEXT.German: Hört die Nachricht Euerer Regierung... Sie verkündet Großes!

TEXT.English: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Feudalism[COLOR_REVERT] allows production of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Men-at-Arms[COLOR_REVERT] and all other unique Man-at-Arms units (with [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Metal Casting[COLOR_REVERT]) and also Mali's mounted [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tuareg[COLOR_REVERT] unit.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Feudalismus[COLOR_REVERT] erlaubt das Aufstellen von [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Streitkolbenkämpfern[COLOR_REVERT] (mit [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Eisenverarbeitung[COLOR_REVERT]) und Mali's [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tuareg[COLOR_REVERT] . Es gestattet auch die Staatsformen [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Vassalentum[COLOR_REVERT] und [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Leibeigenschaft[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: Great Temples can be constructed by Great Prophets and provide a wide variety of bonuses depending on the religion.
TEXT.German: A sacred and famous Temple for a Holy Man.

TEXT.English: Improve your armies! Make yourself some bronze weapons!
TEXT.German: Improve your armies ! Build bronze weapons !

TEXT.English: The first local industries: a way to earn money...
TEXT.German: The first local industries: a way to earn money...

TEXT.English: Allows more trade, and thus more gold!
TEXT.German: Allow more trade, so more gold !

TEXT.English: Turns city production into small amounts of gold and research (at a much worse ratio than later specialized processes).
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grand Arsenal[COLOR_REVERT] is a powerful tool to build a strong navy in a short time.
Faster is better! Build a fast and strong air force.
Rules the sky, hit the ground... You will win your wars!
Diversity is a weapon. Use it well and you will win.
Produces fuel from coal.
Produces Naval Supplies. Naval Supplies allow you to build sailing ships faster.
Provides a defence bonus and +1 happiness to Castles when running Monarchy and Feudal Aristocracy.
Provides +1 culture to Theaters and Operas, and +1 happiness to Schools and Universities when running Despotism and Free Religion.
Provides major global health, happiness, culture, GP and GG bonus, as well as a +25% to all commerce in the capital when running Monarchy and Representation.
Provides a Blessed promotion to units constructed in the city, and a global bonus to certain specialists.
Provides a Blessed promotion to units constructed in the city, and a global bonus to certain specialists.
Provides a Blessed promotion to units constructed in the city, and a global bonus to certain specialists.
Provides a Blessed promotion to units constructed in the city, and a global bonus to certain specialists.
Provides a Blessed promotion to units constructed in the city, and a global bonus to certain specialists.
Provides a Blessed promotion to units constructed in the city, and a global bonus to certain specialists.
The Great Sphinx increases the happiness of your cities owning a Kemet Temple.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Warehouse[COLOR_REVERT] is the first building that can be used to assign Craftsmen.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Humpy[COLOR_REVERT], the Aboriginal replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Warehouse[COLOR_REVERT], offers health, epidemic and production bonuses. Never obsolete.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tipi[COLOR_REVERT], the Sioux replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Warehouse[COLOR_REVERT], offers health, healing and production bonuses. Never obsolete.
The Aborigines replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bora Ring[COLOR_REVERT], which provides a strong culture boost, at a lower cost. Never obsolete.

The Apache replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sacred Pole[COLOR_REVERT], which provides a culture boost and increases your recon units war capacities. Never obsolete.

The Algonquin replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]War Eagle Pole[COLOR_REVERT], which provides a culture boost and increases your military prodution. Never obsolete.

The Haida-Inuit replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]North Totem[COLOR_REVERT], which provides a culture boost and gives "Arctic Combat I" free promo. Never obsolete.

The Cherokee replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Totem Pole[COLOR_REVERT], which provides a culture boost and increases your melee units war capacities. Never obsolete.

The Iroquois replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monument[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Spirit Pole[COLOR_REVERT], which provides a culture boost and gives "River Combat" free promo. Never obsolete.
The Apache replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Smokehouse[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Smoke Signals[COLOR_REVERT], which provides additional city defense.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Storyteller[COLOR_REVERT] provides a small bonus in research.

The Cherokee replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Storyteller[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Elder's Hut[COLOR_REVERT], which provides both a small bonus in research and increases the city's global research. Never obsolete.
The Iroquois replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barrack[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Longhouse[COLOR_REVERT], which provides the usual barrack bonuses and an increased defense bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]City Square[COLOR_REVERT] provides a 10% boost to culture and commerce outputs.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fishing Dock[COLOR_REVERT] increases the food harvested from water tiles.
The Austronesians replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fishing Dock[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fishery[COLOR_REVERT], which provides twice the usual Dock bonus.

The Haida-Inuit replace the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]City Square[COLOR_REVERT] with the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Inuksuk[COLOR_REVERT], which provides the usual City Square bonus and an extra food yield to camps and fishing boats.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Toll House[COLOR_REVERT] provides +15% gold.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tax Office[COLOR_REVERT] provides +25% gold.
Generate income by taxing the roads.
More machines, more food!

Build [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Roads[COLOR_REVERT] or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Paved Roads[COLOR_REVERT]. Efficient roads will improve your economy, a well as culture and religion spreading, and will allow your armies to move faster.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Horse Pasture[COLOR_REVERT] is the native equivalent of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stable[COLOR_REVERT] and allows them to produce [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] in their cities. It can only be built by native civilizations. - adapted from Colonization.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Marae[COLOR_REVERT], the Polynesian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arena[COLOR_REVERT], offers bonus culture.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Heroes' Square[COLOR_REVERT] is the Hungarian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Triumphal Arch [COLOR_REVERT].
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Vegvars[COLOR_REVERT] replace [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]castles[COLOR_REVERT]; they provide additional experience to recon and ranged mounted units.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunic Stable[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stable[COLOR_REVERT]; it gives one free health and a large bonus to mounted light units.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Garden[COLOR_REVERT], the Babylonian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]City Square[COLOR_REVERT], provides one bonus health in addition to the usual happiness bonus. It also gives a bonus to epidemic chance.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cannibal Altar[COLOR_REVERT], the Tupi replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pagan Temple[COLOR_REVERT], provides one free xp to melee unit in addition to the usual culture bonus. It also gives one more food.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunter's Cabin[COLOR_REVERT] provides one free xp to recon units and one food. Its bonuses are active only under Subsistence Economy civic.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunter's Camp[COLOR_REVERT], the Tupi replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunter's Cabin[COLOR_REVERT], provides one more hammer in addition to the usual bonuses. Its bonuses are active only under decentralization civic.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Conucos[COLOR_REVERT] is the Arawak replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Granary[COLOR_REVERT]. As an earthen mound, it is much cheaper to produce. It also provides one happiness with corn.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Batey[COLOR_REVERT] is the Arawak replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colosseum[COLOR_REVERT]. As an earthen structure, it is much cheaper to produce. It also provides some maintenance bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Yaghansua[COLOR_REVERT] is the Patagonian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dock[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides a small commerce bonus. Whale hunting also provides some food resources.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Potter's Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 gold and gives a small bonus versus epidemics.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nubian Potter[COLOR_REVERT] is the Nubian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Potter's shop[COLOR_REVERT]. It increases the epidemic bonus and gives a small culture bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stele[COLOR_REVERT], the Ethiopian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pagan Temple[COLOR_REVERT], provides a major bonus to Culture output in your city and XP to Archery units.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jeweler[COLOR_REVERT] provides a commerce bonus to Precious Mines as well as a happiness bonus with gold, silver and gems.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tailor[COLOR_REVERT] provides a happiness bonus with Silk and Fur resources.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Carpet Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] provides a happiness bonus with Silk and Fur resources.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Haymanot Jeweler[COLOR_REVERT], the Ethiopian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jeweler[COLOR_REVERT], provides a major bonus to Culture output in your city.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rammed Earth Stronghold[COLOR_REVERT], the Bantu replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT], can be built earlier than a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT] and at a reduced cost. No tech is required but walls. It also provides a strong Culture bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Foggara[COLOR_REVERT], the Berber unique building, replaces the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Public Well[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides the same health bonus as the later Aqueduct, and also provides a small food bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aqueduct[COLOR_REVERT] improves a city's health, reduces epidemic chances and is required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Baths[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aquädukt[COLOR_REVERT] verbessert die Gesundheit einer Stadt. Gleichzeitig ist es die Voraussetzung für den Bau der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hängenden Gärten[COLOR_REVERT]. Errichten Sie [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aquädukte[COLOR_REVERT], wenn Sie eine Stadt vergrößern möchten oder die Bevölkerung danach verlangt.

TEXT.English: A city with an [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airbase[COLOR_REVERT] can airlift one unit per turn to any of your other cities. [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Helicopters[COLOR_REVERT] receive 2 free xp.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Airports[COLOR_REVERT] add an additional trade route, as well as raise the commerce from trade routes and also add unhealthiness in cities. It is required to build Seaside Resorts.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arsenal[COLOR_REVERT] grants one free XP to gunpowder units.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arsenale[COLOR_REVERT] grants two free XP to gunpowder and recon units.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Armament industry[COLOR_REVERT] grants two free XP to siege and armoured units.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Artillery yard[COLOR_REVERT] produces Artillery.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Automobile Company[COLOR_REVERT] produces Motor Vehicles resource.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pharmaceutical Company[COLOR_REVERT] produces Pharmaceuticals resource.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Major film studio[COLOR_REVERT] produces Movies resource.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Blast furnace[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong production bonus with copper,coal and iron, provides a free Craftsman and an additional Craftsman slot. It also adds unhealthiness in cities.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pearl Harbor[COLOR_REVERT] is the Polynesian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dock[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides a small production bonus, as well as one happy face with Pearls.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tribe's Hall[COLOR_REVERT] is the minor replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Palace[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides the free building Elder's Council.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Elder's council[COLOR_REVERT] grants a large maintenance bonus in exchange of a large penalty in research and gold income.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Porcelain Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] is the Chinese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Glasswork[COLOR_REVERT]. It produces Glassware resource (used in-game to represent porcelainware as well).
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Judean Fortress[COLOR_REVERT], the Israeli replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Walls[COLOR_REVERT], boosts both science and culture beyond the normal levels.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunter's Grounds[COLOR_REVERT], the Siberian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunter's Cabin[COLOR_REVERT] provides one free XP to recon units, one more food and two more hammers. Unlike the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunter's Cabin[COLOR_REVERT], its bonuses are always active.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tavern[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness with wine and alcohol and an espionage point.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Geisha House[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness with wine and alcohol and an espionage point.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Beer hall[COLOR_REVERT], the Celtic replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tavern[COLOR_REVERT] provides one free XP to melee units and one more happy face with wheat, in addition to the Tavern bonuses.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dun[COLOR_REVERT], the Celtic replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Walls[COLOR_REVERT] increases the city's defenses against pre gunpowder units, and costs less to build.
With two Limestone, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stonecutter[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Masonry Material and a Craftsman slot.
With two Coal, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Brick Kiln[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Masonry Material and a Craftsman slot.
With coal and limestone, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cement Factory[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Cement, one Masonry Material and a Craftsman slot.
With Copper, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bronze Smith[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Bronze resource and a medium production bonus.
With either Fish, Crab, Cattle or Corn, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Canned Food[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Canned Food resource and one Craftsman slot.
With Sulfur, Oil and Coal, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Chemical Plant[COLOR_REVERT] provides one plastic resource and Engineer and Craftsman slots.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clinic[COLOR_REVERT] provides +3 health and also decreases the epidemic chance.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Apothecary[COLOR_REVERT] additionally provides +10% gold and also provides +1 happiness with Tobacco.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clock Tower[COLOR_REVERT] increases various outputs of several other buildings, and as such is best constructed in a city that already has them.
With Electric Gear and Plastic, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Consumer Industry[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Household Appliances resource, one free Craftsman and one Craftsman slot.
With either Sheep (wool) or Cotton, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Textile Mill[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Fabric resource, a small commerce bonus, one free Craftsman and a Craftsman slot.
With Fabric and Dye, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clothing Factory[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Clothes resource, a small commerce bonus, one free Craftsman and a Craftsman slot.
With Coal and Oil, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Synthetic Dye Plant[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Dye resource, a commerce bonus and a Craftsman slot.
With Copper, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Electric Gear Factory[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Electric Gear resource, a small commerce bonus and one Craftsman slot.
With Gold and Electric Gear, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Electronics Facility[COLOR_REVERT] provides two Microchip resources and boosts your research by 15%.
With Uranium, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Enrichment Facility[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Nuclear Fuel resource and boosts your research by 5%.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Designer Outlet[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fur[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT] and raises your commerce income by 5%.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fertilizer Factory[COLOR_REVERT] increases the food or commerce output of many improvements.
With Sulfur, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Powder Mill[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Black Powder resource and one Craftsman slot.
With Steel, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Firearms Factory[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Firearms resource and one Craftsman slot.
With Steel, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]War Factory[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Semi-Automatic Firearms resource and one Craftsman slot.
With Steel, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arms Manufacturer[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Assault Rifles resource and one Craftsman slot.
With Prime Timber and Fabric, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Furniture Factory[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Furniture resource, +5% commerce and one Craftsman slot.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gas Plant[COLOR_REVERT] provides clean power to the city and allow the built of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]GazProm[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Glasswork[COLOR_REVERT] produces Glassware resource.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Guild Hall[COLOR_REVERT] provides a production bonus to your Cottages and a slot for one Craftsman.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fortress Alamut[COLOR_REVERT] boosts your espionage capacities, gives one free Spy and allows you to turn two citizens into Spies.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ishtar Gate[COLOR_REVERT] raises the city defense and gives +2 espionage to all [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Walls[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Leonardo Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] gives +1 culture to all Engineers and scientists in all your cities and +1 production and research to all workshops in your empire.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lubyanka (KGB)[COLOR_REVERT] reduces your war weariness and raises it for your opponents. It also raises your espionage by 25% in all cities and gives you some defense against foreign spies.
With the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]5 Year Plan[COLOR_REVERT], hurry production costs are divided by two.

Under Parliamentarism, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Big Ben[COLOR_REVERT] gives +1 happiness in all your cities and a small GP birth rate boost. It also gives +1 culture to all [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clock Towers[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Quantum Theory[COLOR_REVERT] provides one free scientist and a research bonus. It also gives +1 research to all [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universities[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratories[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Eiffel Tower[COLOR_REVERT] provides a large culture bonus in that city, +2 relations with all other civilizations, and a bonus to culture for all Engineers. Its city has an improved chance of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Engineer[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theory of Evolution[COLOR_REVERT] provides a free technology. It also gives +1 research to all Priests and +2 research to all Scientists.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Betchley Park[COLOR_REVERT] boosts both your espionage defense and your espionage capacities. It gives +1 espionage to [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universities[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]ITER[COLOR_REVERT] provides power in all your cities.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cheomseondae[COLOR_REVERT] boosts your research by 5 points and provides +2 research per scientist in this city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Crystal Palace[COLOR_REVERT] provides two free Steel resources and an +1 production to [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Steel Mills[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Copernicus' Observatory[COLOR_REVERT] grants a bonus to research and a +1 research to [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatories[COLOR_REVERT].
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Das Kapital[COLOR_REVERT] enables all Economy civics. It also provides +1 gold per merchant.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]GazProm[COLOR_REVERT] provides two Natural Gas resources and boosts your Gas income.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hanseatic League[COLOR_REVERT] provides one free trade route in all coastal cities, boosts trade income and gives +2 commerce to each Fair.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Trading Company[COLOR_REVERT] provides a small commerce bonus with 15 resources, a foreign trade bonus and one gold to harbors.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Universal Suffrage[COLOR_REVERT] reduces the war weariness by 25% and raises Golden Age length by 25%.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunter's Camp[COLOR_REVERT], the Tupi replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hunter's Cabin[COLOR_REVERT] provides one more hammer, in addition to the Hunter's Cabin bonuses.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Import Tariff[COLOR_REVERT] reduces the foreign trade route income. It also produces some gold yield income and happiness with Clothes and Naval Supply resources. It can only be built by a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tax Collector[COLOR_REVERT] and under Mercantilism civic.
With the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Industrial Shipyard[COLOR_REVERT], modern navies can be built quickly. It is also needed to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Eirik Raude[COLOR_REVERT] wonder.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Electric Substation[COLOR_REVERT] provides power to your city and its industry. Craftsman will receive +1 production and your city +1 happy face. It needs to be powered to function.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agronomy Station[COLOR_REVERT] raises the food kept in the city and gives +1 commerce or food to certain agricultural terrain improvements.
With Fuel and Power, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agricultural Depot[COLOR_REVERT] raises the food production at the cost of one health.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Foundry[COLOR_REVERT] raises your production with all metal resources and provides +1 free Craftsman and 2 Craftsman slots. It is also need to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Eiffel Tower[COLOR_REVERT].
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Large Stable[COLOR_REVERT] is needed to train [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]War Elephants[COLOR_REVERT]. It also provides some healing bonuses to mounted units.
Under Serfdom, a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Manor[COLOR_REVERT] provides a small production income as well as a commerce bonus to farm and food related improvements.
Unlike regular Manor, a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fazenda[COLOR_REVERT] requires Slavery civic and provides a food bonus to Slave Farms and a commerce bonus to all types of Plantations.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hacienda[COLOR_REVERT] is the Mexican National Building. It gives a small cultural bonus and a maintenance bonus in addition to the manor bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] provides a small boost to the Craftsman specialist production and a Craftsman slot.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Manufactory[COLOR_REVERT] provides a small boost to the Craftsman specialist production and 2 Craftsman slots.
To reduce fossil fuel pollution, build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mass Transit System[COLOR_REVERT]. With fuel and coal, it provides some health to the city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mayor's Office[COLOR_REVERT] reduces the maintenance cost in the city, as well as providing some happiness under democratic civics.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mob Justice[COLOR_REVERT] provides a quick solution to most problems. At the cost of a great loss of culture, +1 happiness is available.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monastic Order[COLOR_REVERT] provides some healing bonus to land units, one more experience to melee units, a small bonus in culture and improves the effectiveness of farms and wineries, at the cost of some maintenance.
With Oil, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Oil Refinery[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Fuel resource, improves Oil Wells and small commerce bonus.
An [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Opera[COLOR_REVERT] boosts your city culture and gives +1 happiness with Hit Singles and/or Hit Musicals.
Not a building, but a visual cue for an ongoing epidemic.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National Patent Office[COLOR_REVERT] boosts your research and gold income, and improves the research output of Scientists and Engineers.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Railway Station[COLOR_REVERT] provides a free trade route and icreases your trade route income.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Retail Store[COLOR_REVERT] provides a large amount of health and happiness bonuses with various resources.
With Aluminium and Iron, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rocket Assembly Plant[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Rockets and Missiles resource and a small commerce bonus.
With Sugar, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Distillery[COLOR_REVERT] provides one Alcohol resource.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]School[COLOR_REVERT] slightly boosts your research and GP points.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Calmecac[COLOR_REVERT] is a unique Aztec school that, in addition to usual bonuses, provides +2 XP to melee and recon units.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Shipyard[COLOR_REVERT] improves naval unit production and provides more food from water tiles.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sakura Garden[COLOR_REVERT] is the Japanese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grocer[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides culture and happiness in addition to the usual bonuses.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dohyo[COLOR_REVERT] is the Japanese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arena[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides the same bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Banya[COLOR_REVERT] is the Russian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bath[COLOR_REVERT]. It doesn't require an Aqueduct to be built, is never obsolete and is very cheap (half a bath cost). It also provides a small culture bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sauna[COLOR_REVERT] is the Finnish replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bath[COLOR_REVERT]. It doesn't require an Aqueduct to be built, is never obsolete and is very cheap. It also provides a happiness bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ranch[COLOR_REVERT] is the American replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Smokehouse[COLOR_REVERT]. It gives +2 XP and a small healing bonus to recon and ranged mounted units.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Smokehouses[COLOR_REVERT] stock food to help increase a city's growth rate. They add health if your city have access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Deer[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cattle[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pigs[COLOR_REVERT].

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mausoleums[COLOR_REVERT], the Indian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Clock Tower[COLOR_REVERT], provides a small culture bonus and allow you turn one citizen into an Engineer.

Under Planned Economy, [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Collective Farming[COLOR_REVERT] provides +2 food and -1 production per Unemployed Citizen, as well as +1 food and -1 production per Craftsman and allows faster improvement construction.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Desalinization Plant[COLOR_REVERT] provides a fresh water source to the city and a free Salt resource..
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Eiric Raude[COLOR_REVERT] provides one free Oil and +1 production per water tile.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ministries[COLOR_REVERT] provide free buildings, depending on their respective domain.
Under Working Class, [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scientific Management[COLOR_REVERT] boosts the bonuses of some specialists.

Under Labor Union, [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Social Guarantees[COLOR_REVERT] boost the bonuses of some specialists and provides one more health and happiness. Meanwhile, it costs many money and raises the war weariness malus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National University[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases the scientific output of its city. It also allows you to change three citizens into Scientists and increases its city's chance of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Scientist[COLOR_REVERT]. Scientists also receive +1 research bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Weaver's Shop[COLOR_REVERT] provides an early gold income.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bath House[COLOR_REVERT] provides a health bonus and reduces the epidemic chance in the city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Print Shop[COLOR_REVERT] gives a culture and commerce bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Newspaper[COLOR_REVERT] gives an increased culture and commerce bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]TV Station[COLOR_REVERT] gives a large culture and commerce bonus.
The costly [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Solar Plant[COLOR_REVERT] provides Power to the city and no unhealth.
Under Slavery, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Slave Market[COLOR_REVERT] provides a bonus to various improvements around the city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Archery Range[COLOR_REVERT] provides 2 XP to all Archer units.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cinema[COLOR_REVERT] provides a small gold income, reduces the war weariness and gives +1 happiness with Hit Movies.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Intensive Farming[COLOR_REVERT] boosts your food production by 10% and another 10% with power.
Build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nuclear Silo[COLOR_REVERT] to produce [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]ICBM[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Carpenter[COLOR_REVERT] is the most basic of the industrial buildings. It boosts your production early in game.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sawmill[COLOR_REVERT] is the most basic of the industrial buildings. It boosts your production early in game.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Siege Workshop[COLOR_REVERT] provides 2 XP to all Siege units.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Steel Mill[COLOR_REVERT] outputs one Steel resource from Iron and Coal.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Alumina Refinery[COLOR_REVERT] outputs one Aluminum resource from Bauxite and Coal.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arc de Triomphe[COLOR_REVERT] is the French replacement of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mt. Rushmore[COLOR_REVERT]
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Brandeburg Gate[COLOR_REVERT] is the German replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mt. Rushmore[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Solar Temple[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's happiness and culture. It is especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temple of Aten[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's happiness and culture. It is especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sol Invictus Temple[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's happiness and culture. It is especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Amaterasu Temple[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's happiness and culture. It is especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Solar Cult Great Temple[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases a city's happiness and culture. It is especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Large Temple of Aten[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases a city's happiness and culture. It is especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aedes[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases a city's happiness and culture. It is especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Amaterasu Great Temple[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases a city's happiness and culture. It is especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Solar Cult Monastery[COLOR_REVERT] allow the production of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sun God Speaker[COLOR_REVERT] and provides a small culture bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Necropolis[COLOR_REVERT] allow the production of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Aten Missionaries[COLOR_REVERT] and provides a small culture bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Basilica[COLOR_REVERT] allow the production of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pontifex[COLOR_REVERT] and provides a small culture bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Honden[COLOR_REVERT] allow the production of [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kannushi[COLOR_REVERT] and provides a small culture bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pyramid of the Sun[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Solar Cult Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Solar Cult[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Great Temple of the Aten[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Solar Cult Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Solar Cult[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Pantheon[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Solar Cult Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Solar Cult[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Atsuta Shrine[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Solar Cult Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Solar Cult[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temple of Solomon[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jewish Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Judaism[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Salomons Tempel[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jüdischer Schrein[COLOR_REVERT]) produziert in allen Städten, die das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Judentum[COLOR_REVERT] praktizieren, 1 Gold/Runde. Außerdem verbreitet er das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Judentum[COLOR_REVERT] in aller Welt und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Church of the Nativity[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Christian Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Christianity[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Geburtskirche[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Christlicher Schrein[COLOR_REVERT]) produziert in allen Städten, die das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Christentum[COLOR_REVERT] praktizieren, 1 Gold/Runde. Außerdem verbreitet sie das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Christentum[COLOR_REVERT] in aller Welt und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Masjid al-Haram[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Islamic Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Islam[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Masjid al-Haram[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Islamischer Schrein[COLOR_REVERT]) produziert in allen Städten, die den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Islam[COLOR_REVERT] praktizieren, 1 Gold/Runde. Außerdem verbreitet er den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Islam[COLOR_REVERT] in aller Welt und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kashi Vishwanath[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hindu Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hinduism[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Kashi Vishwanath[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hindu-Schrein[COLOR_REVERT]) produziert in allen Städten, die den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hinduismus[COLOR_REVERT] praktizieren, 1 Gold/Runde. Außerdem verbreitet er den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hinduismus[COLOR_REVERT] in aller Welt und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mahabodhi[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Buddhist Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Buddhism[COLOR_REVERT] throughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mahabodhi[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Buddhistischer Schrein[COLOR_REVERT]) produziert in allen Städten, die den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Buddhismus[COLOR_REVERT] praktizieren, 1 Gold/Runde. Außerdem verbreitet er den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Buddhismus[COLOR_REVERT] in aller Welt und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dai Miao[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taoist Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces five gold each turn. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taoism[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Dai Miao[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taoistischer Schrein[COLOR_REVERT]) produziert in allen Städten, die den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taoismus[COLOR_REVERT] praktizieren, 1 Gold/Runde. Außerdem verbreitet er den [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Taoismus[COLOR_REVERT] in aller Welt und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: Provides a Blessed promotion to units constructed in the city, and a global bonus to certain specialists.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barbarian camp[COLOR_REVERT] is a barbarian unique building available on the world map only.

Newborn nations are notoriously good at getting important resources from [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]local[COLOR_REVERT] sources. This ability is available for new civilizations formed either by [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]settling barbarians[COLOR_REVERT] or by breaking away in a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]revolution[COLOR_REVERT].
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orthodox Churches[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's happiness and gold income. They are especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orthodox Monasteries[COLOR_REVERT] allow you to create [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Orthodox Missionaries[COLOR_REVERT], who can spread the faith in other cities. They also provide culture and a slight boost to research.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orthodox Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases a city's cultural output. It makes a city's citizens happy if [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Orthodoxy[COLOR_REVERT] is the state religion.
Provides a Blessed promotion to units constructed in the city, and a global bonus to certain specialists.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sreni[COLOR_REVERT], the Indian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Caravan House[COLOR_REVERT], provides an increased commerce yield as well as some food storage capacities.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Scriptorium[COLOR_REVERT], the Armenian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Library[COLOR_REVERT], provides the usual library bonus and a strong culture bonus.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Order House[COLOR_REVERT], the European replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT], provides a small gold income as well as some healing capabilities and free experience to land units.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Baronial Fief[COLOR_REVERT], the European replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT], provides a small gold income as well as some production bonus and free experience to land units.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fortified Mission[COLOR_REVERT], the Texan replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fortification[COLOR_REVERT], provides free experience to gunpowder units, culture and a happiness bonus to all cities on the same landmass.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fortification[COLOR_REVERT] provides some healing capacities to all land units. It also allows the construction of entrenched artilleries to defend the city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Souq[COLOR_REVERT] is the flavor replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT] in the Muslim world.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bazaar[COLOR_REVERT] is the flavor replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Market[COLOR_REVERT] in the Persian world.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mansabdar[COLOR_REVERT], the Mughal replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arsenal[COLOR_REVERT], provides one more XP to all land units and an increased military production (10%). Its cost is also lower than that of an [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arsenal[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cothon[COLOR_REVERT], the Carthaginian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Harbor[COLOR_REVERT], increases trade income and costs 25% less.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]River Dock[COLOR_REVERT] provides one trade route.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Payanam[COLOR_REVERT], the Dravidian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Harbor[COLOR_REVERT], increases foreign trade income and the healing rate of naval units.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nadapu[COLOR_REVERT], the Dravidian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barracks[COLOR_REVERT], grants two free XP to naval units as well as the usual [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Barracks[COLOR_REVERT] bonus. On the other hand, its cost is a bit higher.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nuclear Research Facility[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong research bonus and allows further developments in the fields of Nuclear Power and Nuclear Weapons.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nuclear Expertise[COLOR_REVERT] allows further developments in the fields of Nuclear Power and Nuclear Weapons.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Statue of Zeus[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong culture bonus to the city as well as a free Pagan Temple in all cities.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Olmec Colossal Head[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong culture bonus to the city as well as a free Pagan Temple in all cities.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seated Buddha Statue[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong culture bonus to the city as well as a free Pagan Temple in all cities.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Daibutsu[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong culture bonus to the city as well as a free Pagan Temple in all cities.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Statue of Ganesh[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong culture bonus to the city as well as a free Pagan Temple in all cities.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Statue of Odin[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong culture bonus to the city as well as a free Pagan Temple in all cities.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Provincial Government[COLOR_REVERT], the Chinese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouse[COLOR_REVERT], provides various small bonuses and allows more specialists.
These "buildings" are only used in scenarios for balancing reasons.

These [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Religious Community[COLOR_REVERT] buildings are only available under [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Free Religion[COLOR_REVERT] civic. They give a small bonus in your cities, depending on the beliefs of their citizens.
Herbs and plants: use them wisely, they can heal.
The basics of modern mathematics.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Senate[COLOR_REVERT] boosts your culture and GP rate, and gives +1 happiness in you capital city.
A choice between a federalist or a centralist [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Constitution[COLOR_REVERT] is a powerful way to tailor the effects of your Democracy civic.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Federal Parliament[COLOR_REVERT] and boosts your culture and GP rate.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sacerdotal Palace[COLOR_REVERT] boosts your culture and your Priest specialists.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Noria[COLOR_REVERT] is the Arabian replacement of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aqueduct[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides a boost in food production and allows one Engineer.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Concert Hall[COLOR_REVERT] is the Austrian replacement of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Opera[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides +1 happiness in the city.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stronghold[COLOR_REVERT] is the Lithuanian replacement of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castle[COLOR_REVERT]. It allows one Engineer, boosts the GP rate and the trade route income.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cossack Polk[COLOR_REVERT] is the Ukrainian replacement of the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Arsenal[COLOR_REVERT]. It provides a maintenance bonus and two more XP to mounted units. Its cost is also greatly reduced with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Timber[COLOR_REVERT] resource.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]The Motherland Calls[COLOR_REVERT] is a defensive wonder that summons units to defend the nation immediately when war is declared upon and provides unlimited conscription capacity.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Magna Carta[COLOR_REVERT] provides a commerce bonus to Castles and a direct espionage bonus.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Bath of Mohenjo-Daro[COLOR_REVERT] provides bonus health, a food bonus to Public Wells and a food bonus to Slash and Burn farms.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Nazca Lines[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 food to Farm improvements.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pontus Shipyard[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong bonus to Sailing ship production. This building is also available earlier than the classic Shipyard.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Labor Camp[COLOR_REVERT] provides a production bonus, -1 unhappiness and lowers the war weariness at the cost of one health and a epidemic malus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Imperial Cult[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness to the city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Edict Pillar[COLOR_REVERT] is the Indian subcontinent replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Imperial Cult[COLOR_REVERT]. It also provides +1 happiness to the city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bixi[COLOR_REVERT] is the Chinese replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Imperial Cult[COLOR_REVERT]. It also provides +1 happiness to the city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Orkhon Stele[COLOR_REVERT] is the Turkish and Transoxian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Imperial Cult[COLOR_REVERT]. It also provides +1 happiness to the city.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Local Autonomy[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness to the city at the cost of military production.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]City State[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness and boosts your commerce in that city.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Noble Republic[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness to the Courthouse and boosts the culture bonus of the Castle.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Merchant Republic[COLOR_REVERT] provides one free trade route and boosts your local water tile commerce.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mandate of Heaven[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness in all cities and +25% golden age length.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Local Bureaucracy[COLOR_REVERT] provides a small maintenance bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cental Bureaucracy[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 global health and a culture bonus per specialist.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Colony[COLOR_REVERT] is the Taiwanese National Building. It provides a small boost in food production and +1 health.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Merchant House[COLOR_REVERT] is the Venetian National Building. It raises the foreign trade income and allows two merchants.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Timurid Observatory[COLOR_REVERT] is the Transoxian National Building. It is available earlier, boosts the research and culture and allows two scientists.

Build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Health Resort[COLOR_REVERT] to provide a continental +1 health bonus. It also provides a free scientist for each[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] Hot Springs Park [COLOR_REVERT] in your city radius and increases the chance that a Great Scientist might appear in your city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tambo[COLOR_REVERT] is the Incan National Building. It provides the Tavern bonus and an additional XP bonus to Recon units, a health bonus and some land unit healing bonus.
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seaside resort[COLOR_REVERT] provides a strong commerce bonus at the cost of one health.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sabantuy[COLOR_REVERT] is the Tatar National Building. It provides the City Square bonus and an additional XP bonus to Charge Mounted and Ranged Mounted units, a health bonus with Horse resource, an increased culture bonus and some Charge Mounted and Ranged Mounted unit healing bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tribal Meat House[COLOR_REVERT] is a Barbarian National Building. It provides a food bonus and +1 health.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tribal Games[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness at low cost.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tribal Granary[COLOR_REVERT] is a Barbarian National Building. It provides a food bonus and one health.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Tribal Warehouse[COLOR_REVERT] is a Barbarian National Building. It provides many bonuses: from food production to healing capacities.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pirate Cove[COLOR_REVERT] is a Barbarian National Building. It provides a free promo "Piracy" and +1 commerce to water tiles.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Weaponsmith[COLOR_REVERT] raises the base strength of Melee, Archer and Recon units by +1. Can only be built by Barbarians.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Horse Breeding[COLOR_REVERT] raises the base strength of Chareg Mounted and Ranged Mounted units by +1.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Warrior Hall[COLOR_REVERT] produces two Melee units at a time.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Globe Theatre[COLOR_REVERT] removes all unhappiness from the city in which it is built. It increases the chance of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT]. It grants a culture bonus to all [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatres[COLOR_REVERT].

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National Stock Exchange[COLOR_REVERT] boosts gold output and increases its chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Merchant[COLOR_REVERT]. Each Merchant in this city produces two more gold.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Wall Street[COLOR_REVERT] boosts gold output and increases its chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Merchant[COLOR_REVERT]. Each Merchant in this city produces two more gold.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]National Epic[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases the birth rate of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great People[COLOR_REVERT], particularly [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artists[COLOR_REVERT].
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Basilicas[COLOR_REVERT] reduce Roman city maintenance costs and are required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forbidden Palace[COLOR_REVERT].
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forum[COLOR_REVERT] provides additional commerce compared to regular [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]City Square[COLOR_REVERT]
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agora[COLOR_REVERT] provides an additional research bonus compared to regular [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]City Square[COLOR_REVERT]

An [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Odeon[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's culture and increases the happiness output from using the culture slider. An[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Odeon[COLOR_REVERT] also provides culture and is required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Globe Theatre[COLOR_REVERT].
A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hippodrome[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 happiness and additional happiness from using the culture slider.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Castra[COLOR_REVERT] grant XP to Melee and Recon troops built in their cities and provide a variety of bonuses to different buildings.

The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gymnasium[COLOR_REVERT] grants bonus to Spy and Scientist specialists, as well as some bonuses to the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Library[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatre[COLOR_REVERT]. It allows one Spy in this city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Longphort[COLOR_REVERT] grants free promotion Navigation I to naval units built in this city. It also improves the food output of work boats.

Compared to the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jeweller[COLOR_REVERT] it replaces, the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mint[COLOR_REVERT] provides additional happiness with gold, additional health with salt, and further improves precious mines and salt pits.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Art Era National Wonders[COLOR_REVERT] provide a global culture bonus and allow the construction of era-appropriate [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great Works[COLOR_REVERT].
Each [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Great Work[COLOR_REVERT] provides a large culture bonus as well as a specific bonus.
Each [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Science Work[COLOR_REVERT] provides a large research bonus as well as a specific bonus.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stadium[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 health and happiness.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Football Stadium[COLOR_REVERT] provides +1 health and +3 happiness.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Constable[COLOR_REVERT] provides an espionage bonus under Feudal Aristocracy civic.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Fortified Keep[COLOR_REVERT] raises your defense under Feudal Aristocracy civic.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Heraldic Chamber[COLOR_REVERT] provides a small culture bonus under Feudal Aristocracy civic.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Trade Fair[COLOR_REVERT] provides a free trade route, improves trade route commerce yields and gives +1 commerce to Towns.
Medical projects provide global health bonuses and/or reduce epidemic chances
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Center for Disease Control[COLOR_REVERT] provides a global health bonus. It allows one Scientist in this city.
The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Human Genome Project[COLOR_REVERT] provides a global health bonus and a small boost to research. It allows two Scientists in this city.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bayer AG[COLOR_REVERT] provides 3 Pharmaceuticals as well as a small research bonus to hospitals.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Ford Motor Company[COLOR_REVERT] provides 3 Cars as well as a small production bonus to Mass Transit.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrines[COLOR_REVERT] are founded by Great Generals. Most of them provide certain unit types with unique upgrade lines. Every [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] can only be founded once per game. This "building" is generated by a doctrine and only exists to provide upgrades for units.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrines[COLOR_REVERT] are founded by Great Generals. Most of them provide certain unit types with unique upgrade lines. Every [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] can only be founded once per game.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrines[COLOR_REVERT] are founded by Great Generals. Most of them provide certain unit types with unique upgrade lines. Every [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] can only be founded once per game. Rite of Passage provides unique upgrades to recon units.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrines[COLOR_REVERT] are founded by Great Generals. Most of them provide certain unit types with unique upgrade lines. Every [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] can only be founded once per game. Imperial Glory provides unique upgrades to melee units.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrines[COLOR_REVERT] are founded by Great Generals. Most of them provide certain unit types with unique upgrade lines. Every [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] can only be founded once per game. Art of War provides +1 to both rural and urban logistics.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrines[COLOR_REVERT] are founded by Great Generals. Most of them provide certain unit types with unique upgrade lines. Every [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] can only be founded once per game. War of Attrition provides unique upgrades to mounted units.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrines[COLOR_REVERT] are founded by Great Generals. Most of them provide certain unit types with unique upgrade lines. Every [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] can only be founded once per game. Coastal Raiding provides unique upgrades to naval and melee units.

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrines[COLOR_REVERT] are founded by Great Generals. Most of them provide certain unit types with unique upgrade lines. Every [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Doctrine[COLOR_REVERT] can only be founded once per game. Holy War provides unique upgrades to melee units.
